text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The response clearly walks through the three main jurisdictional tests applied in practice for host-state counterclaims: consent, connection, and applicable law. It explicitly applies these tests to the scenario (silent BIT, UNCITRAL Rules, counterclaim based on environmental damage from construction). It offers a likelihood assessment for admissibility based on the connection test, noting that the factual overlap is strong but the legal basis (domestic law enforcement vs. treaty breach) is critical. It also provides numerous leading cases where tribunals accepted or declined counterclaims, satisfying all components of the criterion.", "criterion_id": "335b696a-2d0f-4cb4-a3f2-fa19a617f230"}
